clinical_study.brief_title: Prediction of Falls in Older Inpatients Hospitalized at Angers University Hospital
clinical_study.official_title: Nurse Screening Tool for Fall Risk : Prediction of Falls in Older Inpatients Hospitalized at Angers University Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to elaborate a new simple clinical tool for the risk of falls among older inpatients.

detailed_description.textblock: Falling is a common event within hospitals, with a rate calculated between 2.9-13 per 1,000 bed-days . Falls lead to prolonged length of hospital stays (LHS). The first step of an efficient and cost-effectiveness strategy of fall prevention is the screening of individuals at higher risk of falls. Recently, a brief geriatric assessment (BGA) composed of a few number of items has demonstrated to successfully predict the risk of prolonged LHS (5). We hypothesized that the use of the BGA items would make it possible to predict the occurrence of falls among older inpatients.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical characteristics (i.e., Brief geriatric assessment items)
primary_outcome.time_frame: recorded at baseline when older adult were admited to acute care units.

clinical_study.condition: to Elaborate a New Simple Clinical Tool for the Risk of Falls Among Older Inpatients.
